column4: i don't understand, whenever i ask about accelerted drivers on the forum, they also respond like i'm an alien from another planet. is it really so odd to have accelerated drivers?
not really
for some, using accelerated drivers from vendor violates their personal philosophy about using open source only stuff
google will not be so judgemental
google has turned up nothing
always worked fine for me, but i don't use vendorn stuff
i know for a fact that google returns a huge number of hits on accerlated X stuff
you know what, i can do without your superior nerd attitude "go google it" bullshit
say something useful or shut up
i wouldn't have suggest it I didn't personally google that exact same subject before
and google certainly helped me with my acceralted X issue
to each his own
because i ALREADY DID IT AND TURNED UP NOTHING USEFUL
dunno if this is relevant to your situ, but -> http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-7832.html
it sounds like it is but that's from the development release - you'd thing that would have been fixed by now?
perhaps, i am unfamiliar with ubuntu so i can't say
... you're in the #ubuntu channel
yes, to get help and opinion on ubuntu distro
here's an opinion - they haven't ironed out the automatic update manager introduced in the latest version
any other issues you've experienced with the auto upd mgr besides vidia stuff?
nope because i didn't get to run it very long before my system was borked
sorry to hear that
keeping an eye on the channel to determne possilbe roadblocks for my first ubuntu install on my lappy
having irc'ed for a while, my skin is thick :)  no biggie
